intro: Chaerophyllum capnoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedge parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a taproot system and produces small, oval fruits called schizocarps. Its aromatic foliage and floral structure make it a distinctive member of the carrot family.
